intro: Nasa dyeri subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its nocturnal blooming habit, with large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid conditions. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique flowering behavior.
